intro: Lefebvrea camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon leafeater, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Lefebvrea camerunensis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
